title: How come Nidalee can heal point click for half her damn HP and Bard's heal does jack?
body:
How can that be possible? Nidalee is already one of those champions difficult to deal with and she has a point click heal that heals a set HP + 50% of her ability power. I can guarantee no one wants to wait for Bard's health pack to "Empower" to get a better heal, they want it now and quick. Not only to mention she increases the attack speed of the someone to?

Meanwhile Bard here has jack for scaling and less bonus ability power. BETTER yet he has to place a HP pack and someone has to WAIT for the empower to get more HP or just go with the other one that doesn't heal at all >->. No matter where you place the HP pack before hand in a fight, it almost never works out because your team doesn't know where it is. The best part of all of this Nidalee's heal costs less mana and Bard's start out with 100 mana at level 1 and scales up to 120? Yeah Nidalee's does the same, but hers heals more!

Fan-freaking-tastic. Buff bard's heal please. Thank you for your time.

Yeah perfect dude... Give Shen a bigger shield than a fighter... because he needs it.  Stacking armor/mr/HP on Shen, just double his shield, totally balanced.

Someone like Riven who doesn't really get to build defense needs a larger shield.  Watching Boxbox on youtube isn't proof she's OP
Are you really arguing that Shen is more oppressive than Riven?  I mean... REALLY?
No. He's arguing that a shield that scales off of defense, on a champion that builds only defense, would _make_ him oppressive. You should try reading the comment next time.
Yet Riven has an AD shield.

Yes, a 1-1 shield on a 6s CD that lasts for 1.5s while Shen's is a .6x AP shield that has a 5s CD and lasts for 3 seconds. Base-wise, Shen's is also a 220 while Riven's is a 210. Honestly, if you snagged any kind of AP item on Shen, it'd make his shield on his W and R block a lot. It's not all that bad to snag a Rylai's or Abyssal on him. Boosts his shield by 60 with Rylai's, by 42 with the Abyssal. His R gets 135 from Rylai's and 94.5 from Abyssal. Both give him defense and help boost his damage slightly while also providing a slightly bigger shield on a friendly. 

You'd honestly be surprised how well an AP Bruiser Shen can tank and dish out damage.
Unlike Riven, Shen can't spam his shield without going OOE immediately though.

Shen can spam his shield without running out of energy actually. The shield is 5s CD and he regens 10 per sec plus also gains 30 energy when his passive procs and his AA's shorten the time on his 9s CD. He also attacks about 1 per sec with the shield making AA's do 2s reduction rather than 1. With 40% CDR if you choose to get it, his W has a 3s CD. Timing your shield prior to an AA that's not a Ki Strike one you'll get at least 4s knocked off in that 3s, bring the CD down to 5s. If you manage to get 2 AA's through, you could get 5s knocked off, meaning you'd Ki Strike 1s after your sheild drops, which would maintain your Energy with 70 energy every 4s when you're consuming 50 every 3. That's just to maintain it though. With other abilities, you could go OOE, but your shield is for immediate deflection or to increase his damage output via his Ki Strike. You're not going to be walking around spamming it just like a Riven wouldn't unless she wanted to get rekt when her shield is on CD. lol.

Not saying Bard isn't underpowered as a support, HOWEVER, his heal can be better in ways than Nids, as Bard can leave and still be able to heal a teammate.  Now this doesn't at all change the fact that he's still just a little too weak right now, but he does have some utility that Nid doesn't have.

Too add on to this, his health packs also give a MS boost and he can have more than 1 down at a time to be used whenever you want rather than a point-and-click and then wait for the CD.  This is especially helpful early game and when doing dragon.  Early game, always start w and lay 2 health packs for your jungler to help with jungle clear and to maybe get that earlier gank off.  Drag and baron, lay 1 before starting and someone who needs it can take it if they want.

Bard really needs a % health heal for his. He isn't AP like Riot originally intended for him to be so he doesn't even utilize the small AP ratio that he has. He shifted to being played as a 100% utility support after people realized it was far better than AP but the only downside is that the heal needs AP to heal.

TL;DR Bard needs his heal to heal % health or have a higher base because his heal originally was meant to scale with the AP items that he doesn't build now.

%hp would make the heal either too strong on tanks or too weak on carries. Making it scale of Bard's %hp wouldn't make sense as he's not a tanky support (and he shouldn't be).
Raising the base stats is probably a good way to buff him, but I think Bard is in a good spot. Most of the Bards I saw lately are doing impressively well, and he's somewhere in the middle of the overall support rankings (9/23) although his winrate is rather low, but this is due to his high skill floor and skill cap. Bard will (should) never be a top solo queue champion because of his nature. He is all built around teamwork and coordination, which is by definition less present in soloQ compared to ranked 5v5 and competitive tournaments. Those who main Bard may shine, but he's never going to be freelo. (Comparable with Thresh who also has a low winrate, although Riot made Thresh too strong on release but after the nerfs, he also never was freelo except for those who mained them and play them well.)

> %hp would make the heal either too strong on tanks or too weak on carries. Making it scale of Bard's %hp wouldn't make sense as he's not a tanky support (and he shouldn't be).

...You do realize there are tons of % health skills in the game right? All of which are balanced to a point where it's not too strong on/vs tanks and on/vs carries? That's like saying putting % health on an AD item would make it way too strong vs tanks and weak vs squishies but as we know BotRK is completely balanced.

And Bard _IS_ a tanky support (and he _should_ be). If you are playing as/with Bards that are squishy then those Bards are doing it wrong. With the items he typically builds he most definitely should be tanky.

My beef that you have to wait for bards heal to bloom before it heals and nidalees is a instant burst heal. Kind of BS.
His packs also give MS boost.
Not arguing either way BUT, Nidalee's heal gives an attack speed boost. Unless that got fixed....stealth changes and all...
And in some cases the attack speed boost is more worthless than the healing portion of Bard's heal.

Wiki gave me numbers:
 	

    Heal: 45 / 85 / 125 / 165 / 205 (+ 50% AP) 

    Attack Speed: 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 / 60%

That's rather strong, especially combined with Janna's shield.

It's strong, but is it useful?

AP's don't scale with attack speed. Imaging Nidalee healing someone like Lux or Brand or Malzahar or most of the other mages in the entire game, and it doesn't do jack shit for them because they don't scale with attack speed at all. Same with a lot of tanks and supports (including Bard!).

In these cases, Nidalee's attack speed buff is a lot less useful than Bard's heal. That's why I said that Nidalee's attack speed boost was more worthless in some cases than Bard's heal.

Not in a solo environment, but in a fight with your adc or a kayle? Yes. Very muchly so yes. 60% for an adc is absolutely massive. I do agree they are situational. I just like to make sure everyone knows whats on the table when they talk. =) I'd personally pick Kayle over Bard. Point and click heal with a higher ratio.
Because Bard is also really mobile, has an execute, and has a nuke. Oh wait....that's also Nid.
